text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian press on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Arab states stress support for comprehensive peace and reject anything that affects Iraq's unity and sovereignity. Arafat tells Arab League Council that Palestinians had reached dead-end in peace talks with Israel.
- Mubarak and Arafat discuss developments on the Palestinian peace track. Arafat says Israel must respect the agreements it signed to push the peace process.
- Public Enterprise Minister Atef Ebeid in Kuwait to discuss joint projects and to take part in seminar on investment in Egypt.
- Prime Minister Ganzouri says private sector will contribute 75 percent of development efforts to improve standard of living and attract investors to Egypt.
- Terrorists kill worshippers outside mosque in Assiut.
- Arab foreign ministers in their emergency meeting take a united stand against Israel's obstinancy and condemn regional interference in Iraq.
- Minister of Trade and supplies Ahmed el-Guweli says 400 million pounds will be set aside for cotton subsidies.
- 19 mining and refractories companies register 305 million pounds which will be distributed among 60,000 employees in November.
- Cotton exchange to reopen in Alexandria after 35 year closure.
- Public Works and Water Resources Ministry calls for evacuation of 15 villages in southern Egypt until Nile flood season is over.
